meanings.definition: Able to be postponed or delayed.
meanings.sent1: The meeting was deferrable until next week.
meanings.sent2: The assignment deadline is deferrable if necessary.
meanings.sent3: The deferrable party was rescheduled due to bad weather.
meanings.sent4: Her deferrable decision to buy a new car saved her money in the long run.
meanings.sent5: The deferrable repair on the roof could wait until the weather improved.

meanings.sent1: The payment was deferrable to the following month.
meanings.sent2: The deferrable task could wait until tomorrow.
meanings.sent3: He made a deferrable promise to fix the leaky faucet.
meanings.sent4: The deferrable decision to move was put on hold due to unforeseen circumstances.
meanings.sent5: The deferrable project allowed for more time to gather resources.
